That's a great idea! Asking your brother directly is a wonderful way to get a sense of what he's interested in or needs. Since you're close, he'll likely appreciate your thoughtfulness and be happy to share his thoughts with you.

When you ask him, try to be specific and open-ended in your questioning. Instead of asking a yes or no question like "Do you want a new gadget?", ask something like "What's been on your radar lately? Is there something you've been eyeing or wanting to try?"

This will help him open up and share his thoughts and interests with you. You might even discover something new about him that you didn't know before!

Also, don't be afraid to ask follow-up questions to get more information. For example, if he mentions a particular hobby or interest, you could ask "What do you like about that?" or "How do you think you'd use that?"

By showing genuine interest and listening to his responses, you'll get a better sense of what he'd truly appreciate as a gift. And who knows, you might even start a fun conversation or discover a new shared interest!

Remember, the goal is to show your brother you care and are thinking of him, not just to get a specific gift idea. By taking the time to ask and listen, you're already showing him you value your relationship and are invested in his happiness.
